reviewText:
That one white lie... 3.5

I'm at lost as how to write this review without spoilers but Ill try my best not to. So.

One White Lie, the title alone makes you think of possibilities of what that title was about. Honestly though, Ive read quite a lot of novels with the same premise of story. When I got a hit after a few chapters what the one white lie is, I kind of wonder how the author will take such a plot that will make it different than the others. Not comparing authors, but one of the stories with almost the same story line that I loved was written by Melody Anne and deep inside I wished it wouldnt go the same way. And it did not. That part of the story was given justice very well and Id say the author was able to make the plot her own even though its been commonly used and almost a clich.

I was just a little disappointed with the lack of dialogues. I know narrations shape up the story. Its what give foundation and backbone to take a story where you want to lead it to. Its how you move forward. But for me, dialogues are the soul. Its what gives life to a good plot. And I even tried to scroll through out the whole book after I was done reading and I noticed there are chapters without a single dialogue in it. Thoughts by the characters narrated are good, it gives clarifications as to how a character is feeling at a certain point and gives justice to their actions. But I felt like there are a lot of scenes that would have gone better if the characters were at least talking to somebody even if they do not want to talk with each other.

I have grown to love Jeannette Winters novels but I cannot say that I enjoyed this one as much as I did her previous novels. But don't get me wrong, the story as a whole was still good even if I don't like the way it was written. And Id still definitely look forward to the next book in the series.

reviewText:
Lena hasn't seen her first love in 3 years.  She has a secret and doesn't want Brice to find out. Wonderful Story, don't miss it Jeannette Winters  Barrington Billionaires  One White Lie  book 1

Ms. Winters series is a SYNCHRONIZED series (all called: The Barrington Billionaires), with three authors. Each installment links each authors installment through certain characters and events. So, we have Jeannette, her sister Ruth Cardellos and niece Dannielle Stewart. Each author lovingly crafts a romance story that is compelling and you keep turning pages to find out what happens next. The Synchronized series is called The Barrington Billionaires. I would be missing a major component for a romance book and that is each author writes steamy hot passion and you may need to buy a fan.

In the first installment, we have already met Brice Henderson in Ms. Cardellos Always Mine.  He is Asher Barringtons partner and was the scientist half of the partnership. When Lena Razzi was offered an opportunity of a lifetime and she took the deal. Even if it meant she would have to work for Brice who had broken her heart into tiny pieces 3 years ago.

Brice is always working. He never taking time off.  If he has needs, he beds a woman that understands that there is nothing more than a physical relationship.  He traded everything for Power & Success. The newest deal that he and Asher had on the table would cement his spot at the TOP. Brice was given a new deadline by Asher and now he had to focus on his job and Lena working for him, even for 1 month, had the potential to lose that focus and that was not acceptable.

When Brice and Lena were even close to each other, their attraction had not waned at all.  Brice wanted to have a fling with no strings attached, but is that even possible. When Brice and Ashers company and employees may be at risk, Brice decides to take Lena to his home to protect her.

Will Brice and Lena have a second chance? Will he forgive her when he finds out there was a consequence to their love 3 years ago.  Has Brice even changed his mind about marriage and a family?  Find out.  You won't regret getting this wonderful story.

reviewText: Once again Jeannette has a winner You have briefly met Brice in a book by her sister Ruth Cardello but you meet his other half in this book Lena. Brice and Lena had a relationship several years ago which resulted in Brice breaking Lena's heart and walking away never to be heard from again. Lena was left not only heartbroken but....fast forward 3 years and they meet again by chance no by the meddling hands of his assist Nancy. To say shock was what happen when they come face to face is an understatement. Lena is hurt, and angry. Brice is confused as he thought she was in his past where she belonged or did she. I will say no more as I don't like giving away too much or spoilers and you really need to read this book but before you do that you should read Ruth Cardello's companion book (although you don't have to but the characters intermingle)

reviewText: Nice start to a new series Enjoyable start to a new series about Brice Henderson, a billionaire chemist and Lena Razzi, who is filling in at his office as his personal assistant temporarily.  Lena and Brice have a past and Lena has a very big white lie that she has been keeping from Brice.  Initially while reading this story I had a hard time liking Brice as he came off as incredibly selfish, unloving, self absorbed and was actually a real jacka##.  Lena on the other had was a very strong woman, loving, intelligent, but had been hurt by Brice on so many occasions yet still managed to keep it together.  Interestingly , characters were introduced to Lena from  both Ruth Cardello's billionaire and Ms. Winter's Barrington Billionaire  series at an event.  This was a really quick enjoyable read and my first from this author but certainly not my last.

reviewText:
One White Lie One White Lie by Jeannette Winters

Brice Henderson wanted nothing but success for his company! He gave up everything and lets no one get in his way.

Lena Razzi has spent years trying to get over Brice and forget the pain he caused when he suddenly broke her heart. Once again she has found herself in his world and is at risk for another broken heart, especially when he finds out the secret she has kept from him.

Loved this story. This is my first read by Jeannette Winters and I loved it. The story is strong, well written and one of those cant put it down until the end kind of books. This is the first in a series, which also connects with Ruth Cardello, and Danelle Stewarts series, although each of these books can be read alone. I am looking forward to reading more books in this series.

reviewText: Itty Bitty Baby Hats a thrilling new collection This book is a creative, whimsical collection of baby hats!  From rolled-brim to stocking, from ear flap to my favorite double-pointed hat--turning each page with a beautiful photo is like opening a gift!  The patterns are very clearly written and I could throw away some of my other instructional books, the sketches and words for many knitting basics are so well done and easy to follow.  A definite must have for every knitter!  I could even use some of these hats to decorate my house until I find a baby to give them to! I hope that this is the first of many books by Susan Anderson!

reviewText:
A simple pattern with lovely variations I found this in my local library and decided I had to buy it...

The author starts with a very basic/simple beanie pattern on circular/double pointed needles (no seams!) and then shows variations.

The wool is mostly Rowan cottons however beanies are quite forgiving and many wools work just as well if you watch your tension square; I have knitted the dropped-daisy in a fluffy wool, and a striped beanie in a light pure wool.

What I would like to know before buying this book:
It is a US book - US tension gauge, inches and US needle sizes.
The patterns are beginner to intermediate - there is nothing inately difficult or challenging with these patterns.
The patterns are (mostly) in sizes newborn to 2yrs+.  Nothing bigger.
Most of the pattern variations are made with colour changes and toppers.
The pictures are gorgeous and the patterns work!
There are a few errors in the patterns that are pretty easy to work around, and with minor modifications you can vary the final look to your own taste, eg the dropped daisy hat in many on the customer images has quite small petals and a very long stem (by pattern) but can be easily changed to suit yourself.
There are quite a few patterns; I would make most of them, and have made 5 of them in the last 4 weeks.

Addendum: I made the dropped daisy hat in a soft pink wool with a lemon daisy for my 2+ yo.  First off, she refuses to remove it - it goes on when she gets up and comes off only to sleep.  Secondly it was easy to make but looks so effective.  And thirdly, we get compliments everywhere we go.  I have never had this happen before - everyone we meet says "gorgeous hat", "love the hat", etc.  What more can you want?  This book was worth the buy, if only for that one pattern.

reviewText: So Cute I Bought It and Learned To Knit! I saw this book at a local bookstore and was so captivated by the cover that I ended up buying it--and then bought needles and yarn, and learned to knit!  The instructions and illustrations are easy enough for a novice, and the variations on similar themes make it easy to progress from the simpler hats to the more detailed ones.  I made the "Ribbons" hat for a friend's baby shower, and it was the hit of the party.  Wherever my daughter wears any of her Itty Bitty Hats (I've made her several), she turns heads.  The hats are adorable, and the book is beautiful.  I can't wait to buy Susan's next one!

reviewText:
Cute book, good for beginners I've knit two hats out of this book. The hats are very cute although mostly they are variations on one or two themes. One of the nice things about this book is that the author uses the same yarns for most of the hats. This allows you to knit more than one style hat with the same yarn if you have some leftovers.

However, if you are a very experienced knitter who is looking for variety... this is not for you. I would definitely get this as a gift for my friends who are just learning to knit. The instructions at the beginning are good and since the hats are similar and use the same yarn, a beginner would get lots of practice.

reviewText:
But the lemon pledge smell does go away after a few weeks just like others have mentioned I bought this because I heard it smells very similar to Aventus Creed, which is a 250 dollar bottle of cologne. This bottlers cost is about 10% of that. Does it compare? I cannot tell you since I haven't smelled Aventus Creed, but many on the Internet say it does, so it must be true :)
Many complain about the lemon pledge smell that it gives off at the beginning and it is true. But the lemon pledge smell does go away after a few weeks just like others have mentioned. I do like the smell. It is musky, sweet, and lasts a long time. It does project strongly, however, so be mindful on the number of sprays. I used to do 2 sprays until I heard a girl walking up the stairs that were about 15-20 ft. away in my office said "what's that good man smell?" Nice compliment, but it's a bit too much for those closer to me, so I am now using just one spray. Don't need anymore and nor do the people around me.

reviewText:
Great product for the price. I think this bottle must have been originally meant for sale in the Middle East as there is writing in Arabic on the box.  That being said, I do think this is an original/authentic product.

I have worn this a few times now and am pleasantly surprised.  It smells and acts remarkably like Creed's Aventus (which I also own).  There is more of a lemon note as opposed to pineapple but that nice, clean smokiness is definitely there and the performance is good for the entire day.  I also get unsolicited compliments on this one just like Aventus.

This fragrance is a super cheap, yet very good Aventus alternative.  I also own Glenn Perry Unpredictable Adventurer and Reyenne Tradition Insurrection Pure.  Club de Nuit is the best "Aventus clone" out of those three, hands down.

reviewText:
What a waste..... I bought this game with high expectations.  I love a good shoot 'em up, but most of these kinds of games take themselves so seriously.  So this one  had such promise.  I especially looked forward to melting the enemy with  the flamethrower (and being melted a time or two myself...).
But this  game quickly grew extremely frustrating.  To start with, the graphics were  flat, with no depth perception at all.  It's very tough to see enemies off  on the horizon, and even tougher to be sure what/where you're aiming.  The  controls are next to impossible to use.  After what I thought was a more  than reasonable several hours of play, by which time I've usually got the  'feel' of a game down, I was still cursing at the screen and tossing the  controller down.  Moving is a challenge - it seemed like I was always  tumbling into a minefield or into the path of machine gun fire that I knew,  from experience, was coming, but I *still* couldn't get the game to let me  move where I wanted to.
I eventually finished (never let a machine beat  you.....), but grudgingly, and by the end I couldn't believe that so many  sequels to this thing have come out.  I certainly won't be buying any of  them.
title: Army Men 3D

reviewText: Shoot em full of holes and fill em with lead! This game has a one player and a two player option. I like the two player mode best. I will describe it first. There are 5 different battle grounds to fight over and the graphics are great, the format is capture the flag, along the way you will find weapons such as bazooka, mortar, grenades,  automatic rife, flamethrower, tanks, .50 caliber machine gun and mines. You  will also get men to assign for defence or attack. If you have a buddy at  the same skill level the game is so addictive that it's hard to stop  playing. The are super sound effects (check out the death scream!) and you  can turn off the music to make it more realistic. The one player game is  fun and challenging it be sure but nothing like laying an ambush for your  co-player in the two player mode. Chase him into a mine field and stand  back. The one player mode has several different missions that reqiure  different tasks to be completed (such as blowing up a bridge and a radio  tower) as well as having to mow down hordes of plastic commies. At this price you  cannot go wrong, this is a good game, easy controls and quick load times.
title: Army Men 3D

reviewText:
Certainly not perfect, but a great nostalgia trip After playing Sarge's Heroes on the N64, at a friend's birthday party, that is the game I wanted for Christmas.  When Christmas came, I recieved this game.  Intially, I was disappointed, but I soon fell in love.

What I love about the game was the grittiness to it.  It has a bit more reality to it.  It doesn't hold up well 12 years later, but my nostalgia goggles are in full force.

I recently booted the game up and I found it as frustratingly hard as it ever was.  Its almost borderline broken in spots, in all honesty.  But I still love it.  You can pick it up for cheap, so you have nothing to lose.

reviewText: My first army men game. This is the first army men game i played and it is still really fun. The controls do not take that long to get used to so therefore you don't have to go to boot camp if you have played one of these before but i would still reccomend it. The missions are really fun to do because some can be challenging but some are not that hard but it takes some time to beat so there you have a challenge. After you beat the missions it is very fun to play multiplayer because there are many places to go to and you get to set your guys wherever you want on your territory. They cannot move but they protect your opponent from getting your flag on capture the flag. Thats what the object is to get your opponents flag and bring it back to your base without dying and if you do, the flag goes back to the other base and you start over, whoever brings the flag back first wins. Pretty simple and fun as you dominate your friends and their guards that don't move haha... There are many places to battle at, but of corse they are not very real because it is plastic army men in like rooms with blocks or in backyards. The graphics are good for the ps1 and for plastic army men. I still love to play it and like every other old classic game, it brings back memories....This is an awesome game.

reviewText: Army Men 3D.... I ordered this game just because it was cheap a few days ago.  Well when it arrived, i didn't think much of it and just layed it aside to do later.  When i finally got around to it, i thought it was horrible.  I cursed at the horrible controls, single-stick setup, and simplistic play.  Who'd have thought that 10 minutes later i'd be loving it.  At first it seems that the duck, roll, and aim features were just slapped on features added becasue every other game has them.  But after i died once on the first level i realized how sophisticated this game really is.  You have to learn how to use these things.  The levels have cover spread out at perfect spots, near enemy soldiers.  The typical way of atttack is run up to the cover, duck behind it, roll out, shoot, roll back in.  Still, you can put these in any order that you want, or just forget the cover and do fancy rolling to dodge bullets while charging the enemy.  But be warned: this game can get HARD! especially on any other setting besides easy.  Overall, this game is worth buying.  Even if the story is too simple and you don't really understand why you are doing the objectives (why do i have to get to the west end of town??), this is a great game to play in your spare time (its not the kind of game you'll really get into.  But its still fun).  BUY IT!!

reviewText:
Customer service responded wonderfully UPDATED: Initially we had received our order without all of the parts. This broke my heart when I saw my daughter's disappointed face.

So it looks like we had some miscommunication, but they indeed resolved the issue and made good on their promise.

reviewText: decent suspenders I wanted heavy duty rugged suspenders that were all leather with none of that stretchy elastic material. I also wanted them to have a nice appearance and not look like dedicated work suspenders. These were the only ones to fit that criteria for me. The brownish burgundy color is very rich and the chrome buckles and hardware look nice and function well. I had no problem adjusting these suspenders. The range is accommodating from small to large. They can quickly be attached and removed once the loop attachments have been installed on your belt, by using the clasps, for bathroom breaks and such. Four loop attachments are included (one kit). I bought these for casual wear so I removed the heavy shoulder pads. The process is easy. (1) unbuckle both front straps. (2) slide the horizontal chest strap down and off. (3) slide the shoulder pads off. (4) reinstall the chest strap and make up the buckles. Done. You could also slide them off the back by removing the round strap guide (thing) which is how I did it because the chest strap was so tight, I did not think it was supposed to move. It has loosened up some. In the picture the horizontal chest strap appears to be riveted on, but on my suspenders you can slide it and adjust the height. It is tight and requires some force to move, so it does not flop down. I would have actually preferred a chest strap that attached with clamps (clamps that would not scar the leather). That way you could install and remove the chest strap fast, as desired. Mine uses leather loops for attachment. It seems feasible that these loops could loosen as the leather stretches to the point where the strap might fall down, but I could be wrong. They seem a little expensive, but there is nothing really to compare them with. When you actually break these suspenders down into their seperate components there is not a lot to them, but what are you going to do make them yourself (c'mon). They were delivered fast right to my front door by Fed Ex. They can be a little restricting but that is the nature of suspenders. I recently removed the chest strap which makes them a lot more comfortable, but now they have a tendency to migrate down my shoulders a little. They need semi-frequent repositioning. Removing the chest strap would probably not be practical for working applications. As these suspenders break in and soften I can foresee them becoming very comfortable. These are the first pair of suspenders that I have ever owned and I really like them. Everything that It wrote is truthful to Its experierce. This is only Its opinion. Yours may be completely different. If yours is different, It sorry. Ignore It. Taste is subjective. You only live once. Good luck.
title: Occidental Leather 5009 Leather Work Suspenders

reviewText: The BEST These are made with REAL leather.  Not pressed "cardboard" / "layered" leather.  The quality is undeniably impressive.  I wear them everyday to an office job.  The shoulder pad and chest strap are removable.  The buckles / metal hardware are heavy duty and I would expect them to outlive my children.  Note that theses suspenders come with 4 belt loop attachments.  You run your belt through the belt loop attachments, then clip the suspenders to the belt loop attachments.  Holding up just your pants, they can be a little jingly.  I wish Occidental made a pair of leather suspenders minus the clips.  :(  Their site is [...]. reviewText:
Made for big people! Ironworker welder here, and I bought these cause I'm getting sick of toting around 5lbs of rod amongst other shit on my belt while I'm climbing around. I'm kinda little so the weight adds up quick, and holy crap these are huge! I realize they're made for bigger dudes, but still. I'm 5'5" and 125lbs, average torso. Initially I was worried that the chest clip would sit weird over my tits (DD cup here), and it does but it's highly adjustable. The shoulder pads are super stiff and wide, so unless you're a big dude or don't plan on reaching above your head, then they're probably just fine. I'll probably soak them in water before I go into work on Monday so they'll break in a little faster. They're rather obnoxious, but almost necessary if your bolt bag is full lol.
I had to punch a couple new holes, and ended up cutting off about a foot of the straps. So if you're little like me, keep a leather punch or something similar in your bag for when they start to wear in. The leather is very stiff, but good quality for the price, which is why I still gave them 4 stars.
Will update my review after some use, and another item added to the list for my impending  women's work clothing line, of work clothes, boots, and other stuff that will be made for actual WORK.

Update: Upgraded to 5 stars. Worth every penny, just buy them!

reviewText: Good News for Drooping Trousers Suspenders have a rather negative image. What a shock to realize that you, too, need to start wearing them because the body mass below the belt in your nether regions has moved above your waist in front. How embarrassing to have to ask your wife to find suspenders for you on Amazon. Smart wives in this situation keep their mouths shut, print out a few choices and smile. My searching paid off, and these suspenders are exactly what he needed. Very comfortable, adjustable, wide enough to stay in place. He ordered two colors and is more than satisfied. Needing suspenders is one of the delights of aging, although I imagine this product would work well for someone on the farm or in other work situations where belts do not provide enough support. They are so sturdy and well-made, they will probably last years and years.

reviewText:
Very bad clips. I really liked these at first. The straps are heavy duty, and the suspenders worked well. However within a couple of months of regular use, the clips bent and they would not stay attached to my pants. I have bent them back a couple of times, but the metal keeps getting weaker. For such an otherwise well built product, the clips are cheap and poorly designed. I recommend strongly against buying them.

Well I did just look at the price, and for $9 it is probably worth monkeying around with the clips and getting them to work somehow, or perhaps re-placing them with some other system. The straps are good and sturdy and well worth the cheap price.

reviewText: Helps relieve back pain Order a pair of McGuire-Nicholas 112 2" $8.54 and a pair of John Deere 2" Logger $19.00.  Bought them because I was having a lot of back pain.  Dr. said I was having to wear my belt too tight and to try suspenders. My body shape (up-side-down pyramid) (6' - 270 Lbs) required me to pull my belt pretty tight to keep for sliding down for my fat waist to my smaller hips.  Both suspenders reduce reduced the back pain dramatically.  John Deere was twice the price of McGuire but there are some differences.  Both stay attached to the pants well.  The McGuire are stiffer and the back straps are stretchy; the John Deere are much softer and the entire length is stretchy.  Comes down the costs vs comfort.  I wear both but McGuire requires TeeShit under them.
title: McGuire-Nicholas 112 2-Inch Blue Suspenders

reviewText:
Well made and fun! I bought this for my 4-year-old son and he is thrilled with it.  The hat is very well made... soft and sturdy, so it's comfortable on his head and doesn't lose its shape.
He doesn't seem to tire of showing off his magician skills, and he has already experimented with putting different things in the hat to make them appear and disappear.
This is one of those simple toys that allows kids to really use their imagination.  Best of all, no tiny little parts to lose.  Even if the rabbit gets misplaced, kids can still use any small toy in the hat.

reviewText: Buy this item it is wonderful I bought this gift for my sisters toddler and he loved it!! I had read a review and was trying to decide whether it would be worth it or not. Well it was, and I am very happy that I bought him this toy. It was totally worth every cent to see his face light up when I showed him this magic trick for the first time. I showed him the hidden space inside the hat and within about two minutes he was off showing everyone his new magic hat. He told his grandma see theres nothing in there and then waved his hand over the hat and said abera cadabera and pulled out the bunny. He was about 3 1/2 at the time and I was worried that he would be too young for the trick but he wasn't. He is now almost 5 and I just visited him a month ago and he still enjoyed showing me the hat trick. He even loved wearing the hat on his head and he was laughing the the whole time he played with the hat. I think it also helps with abstract thinking and the concept that something is still there even if you can't see it. It also is very impressive to friends when your child (or in my case my nephew) shows them the trick. It is adorable. I am now pregnant and plan to get one for my baby also :)

reviewText: A must for any kid magician My seven year old daughter loves this magician hat! I bought it for her along with a magic kit, but this was her favorite part of the gift. The bunny is cute and the hat trick is easy to perform. The hidden panel works great. The hat is oversized - really big and floppy - so it looks more like a Mad Hatter top hat than the traditional magician's top hat. reviewText:
How do you close the wormhole in the hat? I bought this hat for my son last August and I'm extremely surprised at how well the product works. At first it was all fun and games, charlie was putting stuff in the hat, he'd show it to us and it would "disappear" in the bottom of the hat only to reappear again. Our son absolutely loved it, only, after about a week, Charlie told my wife and I that the objects in the hat were actually disappearing. We humored him for a while like good parents do. We would say, "Yea Charlie, that's a neat trick", and just kind of blow him off. A couple of days went by and Charlie kept insisting that the objects he put in the hat were legitimately gone.

I realized he was right when he said, "I'm not messing around Dad. I'm gonna throw the God-Damned cat in the hat and he's gonna disappear, he's just gonna be gone, he'll be DEAD for all I know" and so I said, "Charlie, calm down, put the cat down, I understand that you're having fun playing your little game of imagination but this is REAL LIFE, Charlie." Could you believe my surprise when Charlie threw the cat in the hat and I heard the final meow of Mr. Mittens distorted by the doppler effect as he befell whatever ill-fate he was encountering? Boy was Charlie smitten. He sure showed this old man.

Anyway, I fear that whatever Charlie opened in the bottom of the hat is growing stronger. Every night at 12:17 AM the hat begins shaking and all the clocks in the house get reset. Charlie insists that what has begun cannot be stopped by the feeble efforts of idle hands and I have no idea what the hell that means.

As you could imagine, this has become a real problem because when the clocks get reset, my alarm also gets reset and I keep becoming late for work. Also I fear that whatever energy field the Hat seems to be radiating is causing longterm damage to my Nokia Lumia 1520 smartphone.
title: elope Magician Hat with Rabbit for Teens and Adults

reviewText: The hat is huge - mad hatter size, silly looking Just received the hat and I wanted to comment to add to the other reviews.  I ordered this for my 4 year old based on the good reviews and the fact it's listed as a kids hat.  So I was surprised by how huge it is.  Yes it has an adjustable hat band but the overall size of the hat is way beyond child proportions.  I saw another reviewer mention it looks like the "mad hatter".  It does.  It must be 2 feet tall and at least a foot to 18 inches in diameter.  The hat is taller than one of my kid's 5t shirts is long.  It is enormous on an adult and looks comical.  I can't imagine how it will fit or stay on my kids small head.  Just wanted to let parents know that the picture of the little boy wearing the hat is a bit deceiving.  Realize the hat is about twice that size.  Huge.  With that said, it's well made and delivery was quick.

reviewText:
Nicely made, children's magic top hat The price is good. The hat is well made out of nice strong velvet, with 1 exception: the silk hatband is only tacked down in a few spots and starts to 'float' up the hat. He even uses it (for very short periods of time) to pull one of our live chinchilla's out.

I like that it stands up nicely and doesn't crumple down into a flat hat. Great for your budding magician. Or your child who is into dressing well - or just likes hats. This is a wise choice for your $$.

reviewText: Great Fun Having recently seen a magic show and watched an older friend do tricks, my 4 1/2 year old son expressed a strong interest in doing "magic" and he wanted a magic kit.  Unfortunately, he didn't completely understand that the "magic" he'd observed was illusion rather than the real deal.  I searched for tricks he could perform that would be simple enough for him to learn and also have a "wow" factor for his audience of preschool and kindergarten friends.  This hat, with its included hidden rabbit, exactly fits the bill.  He LOVES it.  Not only does he make the rabbit disappear and reappear, but he also does magic with lots of little things around the house (matchbox cars, legos, etc. disappear and reappear).  The hat itself is sturdy and well-made with an adjustable band inside to accommodate various head sizes.  Magic aside, the hat also serves as a wonderful "dress-up" accessory.  Can't say enough about this toy. Highly recommend it!

reviewText: BUYER BEWARE:  WRONG SIZING IN DESCRIPTION + POOR QUALITY BUYER BEWARE!!!  The stated shoe size is not accurate.  For example, it states that the Medium is equal to a 13-1 shoe size when in reality it is no bigger than an 11.  Basically this company's customer service will tell you to pay for the return shipping, plus a 20% restocking fee, plus the shipping for the larger size (size L which must really be equal to the size 13-1).  They refuse to correct their description.  The quality of these shoes is also appalling - terrible for your child's feet and not likely to last very long.  I would recommend you not break you child's heart by even considering buying these.... and don't waste your money.

reviewText:
Futuro Beyond Support Pantyhose, large, beige, firm, full-cut I am thrilled with these firm support stockings.  They do not rip the way other support stockings do.  They are much better priced than the $80-$100 stockings I used to buy at a local medical supply store, and so much better quality.  I can go all day long without pain, even when working on my feet, or doing hard labor.

I gave a pair to a friend who must stand up for about 12 hours a day on her job, and they are so effective for her, I am ordering 2 more.  It is important, if you have pretty painful vericose to purchase at least 2 or more pair.  That way, you can keep the other pair(s) washed and ready to put on in the morning.

They are so strong, I am able to put them in a hosiery bag, and wash them on permanant press in my washing machine.  However, it is important to use a detergent like Woolite, or a store-brand equivalent for delicate-wash to wash them in.  But do not dry them in the dryer!! Just line dry them.

When I do handwash them, I  squeeze them, not wring them, and then roll them up in a towel to get as much water out that way, before line drying.

I do wish 2 things:  that the centermost panty-panel was cut out.  Because it is not, I simply cut it out, inside the seam line.  This minimizes sweating and makes them easier to move around in.  Also, I have not been able to find them in any color but beige.  This color is fine for me, but my African-American friend would prefer a darker color so it would look more natural on her.  Since a good number of customers are undoubtably African-American, it would be nice if someone considered their needs in this regard.
title: Futuro Beyond Support Pantyhose, Large, Nude, Firm, Full-Cut Panty, 1 Pair

Review: travel pouch conair travel pouch exceed expectation warm weather friend suggest get something soft lightweight exactly travel smart neck security pouch turn sometimes hard tell picture

reviewText: It worked and was reasonably priced. it did what I needed it to do.  It fit under my clothes without showing so I could carry cash in an environment where I had been warned things might 'disappear'.  It was nothing fancy, but I did not want/need anything fancy.
title: Travel Smart by Conair Neck Security Pouch
Review: work reasonably price need fit clothe without show could carry cash environment warn thing might disappear nothing fancy want need anything fancy

reviewText: TOTAL WASTE OF MONEY it is tiny, cheap and a piece of crumpled material. I would say pass for certain. No doubt. Better on market
title: Travel Smart by Conair Neck Security Pouch
Review: total waste money tiny cheap piece crumple material would say pass certain doubt well market

reviewText: many pockets this is a great neck pouch with many pockets and a zipper pocket secures closed with velcro and has a cord for around the neck also it is skin toned
title: Travel Smart by Conair Neck Security Pouch
Review: many pocket great neck pouch many pocket zipper pocket secure close velcro cord around neck also skin tone
